intro: Convolvulus pellitus f. anestius, commonly known as the pale convolvulus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae). It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, funnel-shaped flowers typically in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and adaptable species within its native range.
